summary: This is a Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG) memorandum documenting a voluntary interview conducted on October 27, 2021, with the Chief Psychologist of the Federal Bureau of Prisons at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York. The interview was part of the OIG's investigation into the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein at MCC New York in 2019. The memorandum references attached transcripts and documents, including an FBI 302 and a BOP After Action Review.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the OIG investigation; he died while housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York in July and August 2019.

events.title: OIG Interview of Chief Psychologist
events.description: Special Agents from the DOJ Office of the Inspector General conducted a voluntary interview of the Chief Psychologist of the Federal Bureau of Prisons at MCC New York regarding the death of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: FBI Interview of Chief Psychologist
events.description: The FBI conducted an interview of the Chief Psychologist, as referenced by an attached FBI 302 document.

events.title: BOP After Action Review
events.description: The Bureau of Prisons conducted an After Action Review, likely in response to Jeffrey Epstein's death.

events.title: Epstein Housed at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was housed at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York in July and August 2019 prior to his death.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, New York
keyFacts: The DOJ Office of the Inspector General interviewed the Chief Psychologist of the Federal Bureau of Prisons at MCC New York on October 27, 2021, as part of its investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death.
Jeffrey Epstein (Register Number 76318-054) was housed at MCC New York in July and August 2019.
The Chief Psychologist was in charge of the MCC Psychology Unit responsible for mental health evaluations and treatments of inmates during Epstein's incarceration.
Attached documents include a transcribed interview from October 27, 2021, an FBI 302 from an interview on August 29, 2019, and a BOP After Action Review dated August 10, 2019.
The memorandum is an internal OIG document not to be distributed outside the receiving agency and contains neither recommendations nor conclusions.
